Docs.summary: 3GPP TS 24.

remarks.para:
3GPP TS 24.008 10.5.4.7 Called Party BCD Number
See Also TS 51.011 10.5.1 "dialing number/ssc string" and TS 11.11 "10.3.1 EF adn (Abbreviated dialing numbers)"

Docs.summary: Compare phone numbers a and b, and return true if they're identical enough for caller ID purposes.

remarks.para: Compare phone numbers a and b, and return true if they're identical enough for caller ID purposes. Checks a resource to determine whether to use a strict or loose comparison algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ConvertKeypadLettersToDigits (string input);
.method public static hidebysig string ConvertKeypadLettersToDigits(string input) cil managed

Docs.summary: Translates any alphabetic letters (i.e.

remarks.para: Translates any alphabetic letters (i.e. [A-Za-z]) in the specified phone number into the equivalent numeric digits, according to the phone keypad letter mapping described in ITU E.161 and ISO/IEC 9995-8.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ExtractNetworkPortion (string phoneNumber);
.method public static hidebysig string ExtractNetworkPortion(string phoneNumber) cil managed

Docs.summary: Extracts the network address portion and canonicalizes (filters out separators.) Network address portion is everything up to DTMF control digit separators (pause or wait), but without non-dialable characters.

remarks.para:
Extracts the network address portion and canonicalizes (filters out separators.) Network address portion is everything up to DTMF control digit separators (pause or wait), but without non-dialable characters.
Please note that the GSM wild character is allowed in the result. This must be resolved before dialing.
Returns null if phoneNumber == null

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ExtractPostDialPortion (string phoneNumber);
.method public static hidebysig string ExtractPostDialPortion(string phoneNumber) cil managed

Docs.summary: Extracts the post-dial sequence of DTMF control digits, pauses, and waits.

remarks.para:
Extracts the post-dial sequence of DTMF control digits, pauses, and waits. Strips separators. This string may be empty, but will not be null unless phoneNumber == null.
Returns null if phoneNumber == null

MemberSignature.Value: public static string FormatNumber (string phoneNumber, string defaultCountryIso);
.method public static hidebysig string FormatNumber(string phoneNumber, string defaultCountryIso) cil managed

Docs.param: the ISO 3166-1 two letters country code whose convention will be used if the given number doesn't have the country code.
Docs.summary: Format a phone number.

remarks.para: Format a phone number.
If the given number doesn't have the country code, the phone will be formatted to the default country's convention.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string FormatNumber (string phoneNumber, string phoneNumberE164, string defaultCountryIso);
.method public static hidebysig string FormatNumber(string phoneNumber, string phoneNumberE164, string defaultCountryIso) cil managed

Docs.param: the E164 format number whose country code is used if the given phoneNumber doesn't have the country code.
the ISO 3166-1 two letters country code whose convention will be used if the phoneNumberE164 is null or invalid, or if phoneNumber contains IDD.
Docs.summary: Format the phone number only if the given number hasn't been formatted.

remarks.para: Format the phone number only if the given number hasn't been formatted.
The number which has only dailable character is treated as not being formatted.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string FormatNumberToE164 (string phoneNumber, string defaultCountryIso);
.method public static hidebysig string FormatNumberToE164(string phoneNumber, string defaultCountryIso) cil managed

Docs.param: the ISO 3166-1 two letters country code
Docs.summary: Format the given phoneNumber to the E.164 representation.

remarks.para: Format the given phoneNumber to the E.164 representation.
The given phone number must have an area code and could have a country code.
The defaultCountryIso is used to validate the given number and generate the E.164 phone number if the given number doesn't have a country code.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
